Class Movement

java.lang.Object
domain.Character
domain.Zombies
domain.Movement
Direct Known Subclasses:
Basic, Buckethead, Conehead, ECIZombie
public abstract class Movement extends Zombies
Represents a zombie with movement capabilities in the game. This class extends the Zombies class and adds the ability to move across the game board, as well as attack plants. Movement is an abstract class, allowing subclasses to implement specific zombie behaviors. Movement includes functionality for: - Moving across the game board if the zombie is in a movable state. - Attacking plants when encountering them on the game board. - Managing attack timing with a scheduled executor. - Stopping the attack timer when the attack ends. The Movement class is intended to be a base class for specific types of zombies that require mobility and attack behavior.

  • Constructor Details

    • Movement

      public Movement(int hitPoints, int damage, int costbrains, int timeattack, int timemove)
      Constructs a new Movement instance representing a zombie with the ability to move and attack. Inherits basic zombie attributes from the Zombies class and adds specific properties for movement and attack behavior.
      Parameters:
      hitPoints - the total health points of the zombie.
      damage - the amount of damage the zombie can inflict on plants.
      costbrains - the number of brains required to deploy this zombie.
      timeattack - the time interval, in seconds, between each attack on a plant.
      timemove - the time interval, in seconds, for the zombie to move across cells.

  • Method Details

    • isMoving

      public boolean isMoving()
      Determines if the zombie is currently in a moving state.
      Returns:
      true if the zombie is moving, false otherwise.

    • setMoving

      public void setMoving(boolean moving)
      Sets the moving state of the zombie.
      Parameters:
      moving - a boolean value indicating whether the zombie is in motion. If true, the zombie is marked as moving; if false, it is not moving.

    • move

      public void move(Board board, int row, int col)
      Moves the zombie to a different cell on the game board, if possible. The method handles movement logic, including removing the zombie from its current position, setting it in a new position if the adjacent cell is empty, or initiating an attack if the adjacent cell contains a plant.
      Parameters:
      board - the game board on which the zombie is located.
      row - the row index of the zombie's current position on the board.
      col - the column index of the zombie's current position on the board.

    • attack

      public void attack(Plant plant)
      Performs an attack on the specified plant. If the plant is alive, its hit points are reduced by the damage value of the attacking entity.
      Parameters:
      plant - the Plant object being attacked. The plant's hit points will be decreased if it is alive.

    • getDamage

      public int getDamage()
      Retrieves the damage value of the zombie.
      Returns:
      the amount of damage the zombie can inflict on plants.

    • stopAttackTimer

      public void stopAttackTimer()
      Stops the attack timer associated with the zombie's scheduled attack cycle. If a scheduler exists and is not already shut down, this method will forcibly terminate all active tasks and shut down the scheduler. This is typically used to halt any ongoing attack behavior, such as when the zombie is no longer attacking a plant or the zombie is removed from the game.
